summary: This is an FBI news briefing from July 6, 2020, covering a wide range of topics including protests, counter-terrorism, criminal investigations, and other national news. The most significant item related to the Epstein case is the report of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest on charges of trafficking minors for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British socialite arrested on charges of helping Jeffrey Epstein lure and traffic underage girls for sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Late financier accused of victimizing dozens of girls and women; Maxwell is charged with facilitating his crimes.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Old friend of Epstein mentioned in connection with the investigation; prosecutors want to talk to him.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Acting US Attorney for the Southern District of New York involved in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: William Sweeney
persons.context: Head of the FBI's New York office, commented on Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney representing Epstein accusers, commented on Prince Andrew's situation.

persons.name: Robert Maxwell
persons.context: Late father of Ghislaine Maxwell, mentioned in passing.

persons.name: Boris Johnson
persons.context: Denied that the FBI contacted him for assistance in interviewing Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Robert Stryk
persons.context: Washington lobbyist consulted by Prince Andrew's lawyers about his Epstein case fallout.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of facilitating Epstein's crimes by recruiting, grooming, and abusing underage victims for him.
Described as an old friend; Maxwell's arrest increases pressure on Prince Andrew to cooperate with the investigation.
Old friends; Prince Andrew's ties to Epstein are under scrutiny by investigators.
Prince Andrew's lawyers consulted lobbyist Robert Stryk about assistance with fallout from his Epstein relationship.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire on charges of sex trafficking minors for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Maxwell Indictment Unsealed
events.description: A six-count indictment was unsealed charging Maxwell with enticing minors, transportation of a minor for illegal sex acts, and perjury.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail while awaiting trial on federal sex trafficking charges.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in New Hampshire and charged with sex trafficking minors for Jeffrey Epstein.
The indictment alleges Maxwell recruited, groomed, and abused at least three girls, one as young as 14, from 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is also charged with perjury for lying under oath in a 2016 deposition related to Epstein.
Prince Andrew is under pressure to cooperate with the FBI investigation; his lawyers have contacted the DOJ but claim no response.
The arrest followed a year-long investigation after Epstein's death, with the FBI monitoring Maxwell's whereabouts.
